title: De Leon on Inca Roads MCQ 3

content.question: Which of the following pieces of evidence does the author use to support his argument about the pride of Inca rulers in the second paragraph?

choices.label: Inca rulers followed the method of dynastic succession for passing political authority from one ruler to another.
Inca rulers performed religious ceremonies to bless the highways and those who traveled on them.
Inca rulers had officials assign men from the provinces to construct the highways.
Inca rulers typically tried to construct bigger and broader highways than their predecessors if they wanted to undertake conquests.

content.answer: Inca rulers typically tried to construct bigger and broader highways than their predecessors if they wanted to undertake conquests.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Identify the evidence used in a source to support an argument.
